intro: Bumelia austin-smithii, commonly known as Austin's bumelia, is a rare shrub native to the central Texas Hill Country. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
